alert.note: Alert for Pima; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 13 at 7:06PM MST until August 13 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Pima County in southeastern Arizona... Southeastern Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 1100 PM MST. * At 706 PM MST, Emergency management reported flash flooding was occuring along the Canada del Oro Wash near Edwin road near the Pima/Pinal county line. This Flash Flood wave will continue to make its way down the CDO Wash Through Catalina and Oro Valley into the late evening hours. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Catalina, Oro Valley, Marana, Casas Adobes, Saddlebrooke and Catalina State Park. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
